image.altText: Troy Bell walks outside a court building holding a note pad.

props.synopsis: A District Court jury has found independent Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell guilty of multiple theft and dishonesty offences after deliberating for two days.

title.children: Jury finds independent Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell guilty of theft and fraud

image.altText: Four men in hats, caps, two have grey moustache, stand on boat with shovel, nets, water in background.

props.synopsis: Once depleted and forgotten, native oysters are back in Coffin Bay after moves to revive the "ecological superheroes".

title.children: Early settlers nearly ruined this ecosystem. Now a community is trying to right historical wrongs

image.altText: Piggy bank and overdue bills

props.synopsis: Financial counsellors have weighed in on the cost-of-living crisis currently gripping the country, giving some of their best tips to saving money and avoiding getting price gouged.

title.children: Barefoot Investor among financial counsellors offering tips to tackle SA's high cost of living

image.altText: Unripe tomato plants growing together.

props.synopsis: The outbreak has already led some states to impose bans on SA tomatoes and fanned growers' fears the restrictions could cause more harm than the virus itself.

title.children: As the fallout from the tomato virus outbreak continues, how could it affect prices at the checkout?

image.altText: Charlie Dixon pumps his right fist after kicking an AFL goal for Port Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Six days after its AFL finals exit, Port Adelaide is already bracing for a revamped line-up for next season, with key forward Charlie Dixon announcing his retirement and All-Australian defender Dan Houston signalling a desire to return home to Victoria.

title.children: Power disruption as Dixon retires and Houston flags intention to return home

image.altText: hundreds of people gather looking at several people speaking on the steps on parliament house

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 people have turned up at the steps of South Australia's Parliament House in support of a proposal to change state abortion laws.

title.children: Hundreds rally in support of proposed changes to SA's abortion laws

image.altText: A woman leans on a large trolley with multiple suitcases on it, and looks on

props.synopsis: Australians trying to leave Lebanon fearing an increase in hostilities between Israel and Hezbollah are running out of options, as flights are cancelled and the IDF's top commander highlights the possibility that troops will cross the border.

title.children: Aussies stranded in Lebanon amid fears of possible Israeli ground invasion

image.altText: Secret service pic

props.synopsis: A new report gives the most detailed timeline to date of how the Pennsylvania assassination attempt unfolded, revealing the shooter was on the roof for six minutes before he opened fire.

title.children: The FBI says the would-be Trump assassin 'climbed up an air conditioning unit' before opening fire

image.altText: A serious-looking older man in a dark suit stands behind a lectern in front of an Israeli flag.

props.synopsis: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu says reports of an imminent ceasefire are incorrect, saying he "did not even respond" to the ceasefire proposal and has instructed the IDF to keep fighting with full force.

title.children: Netanyahu rejects call from US, Australia for immediate 21-day ceasefire in Lebanon

image.altText: A man watching football having an angry reaction

props.synopsis: The AFL and NRL grand finals are a time of celebration for many, but experts warn it can be a period of heightened risk for domestic violence. Berry Street, a domestic violence support service, is preparing for a busy weekend, after experiencing a 30 to 40 per cent increase in demand during the 2023 grand final weekend.

title.children: Grand finals 'are full of emotion and passion' but can be a time of heightened risk for domestic violence

image.altText: A soldier covers his ears as a tank explodes

props.synopsis: Israel has been giving strong signals it plans to launch a ground invasion of Lebanon as part of its war against Hezbollah, but whether it has learnt from its last military campaign in the country remains to be seen.

title.children: What Israel can learn from its 2006 ground invasion of Lebanon, which 'failed completely'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: For many of us, COVID has become just a bad memory, despite its lasting and mixed legacies. But experts are urging that we learn from our mistakes and plan ahead.

title.children: COVID's long shadow looms as Albanese urged to lead on pandemic planning

image.altText: LOST PARADISE

props.synopsis: The US ticket-selling platform Lyte has shut down, leaving two Australian music festivals in the lurch.

title.children: 'We are taking this situation seriously': Aussie festivals respond after US ticketing agent shuts down

image.altText: Two Chinese men in suits sit in chairs behind a desk

props.synopsis: China test-fired an intercontinental ballistic missile into the Pacific Ocean this week. Why the Pacific, and why now?

title.children: China just launched an intercontinental ballistic missile into the Pacific Ocean. Why now?

image.altText: Head shot of ABC Editorial Director Alan Sunderland.

props.synopsis: A Walkley-winning journalist who spent 40 years working for SBS and the ABC will head an independent review into the 2022 reports, including a story that included an "editing error in the audio" of helmet cam footage captured by commandos in Afghanistan.

title.children: ABC appoints Alan Sunderland to conduct independent review into Line of Fire reporting

image.altText: A man walks among media holding up a hi-vi green jacket near his face

props.synopsis: A South Australian man who allegedly inflicted injuries to the baby boy in July has been arrested today and charged with manslaughter.

title.children: Man who allegedly killed seven-week-old baby released on bail

image.altText: A couple smiling in a black and white photo, holding a baby.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering a top paediatrician and the woman alleged to have helped him cover up the crime have been ordered to stand trial in the Supreme Court.

title.children: Duo accused in connection to death of top doctor plead not guilty

image.altText: A selfie of a woman on a dirt road in the outback. She has a fly net and go pro on her head.

props.synopsis: Vicky turned to the rugged outback and Australia's longest-marked walking trail to rediscover the beauty of the world and process her grief.

title.children: Grieving her daughter, Vicky sought somewhere she didn't have to put on a 'brave face'

image.altText: Molten steel shoots out of jets inside a steelworks factory.

props.synopsis: The SA government says it has sought advice from insolvency experts about the situation at the Whyalla steelworks, with the premier acknowledging contingency plans are being made for every possible "eventuality", including "something going wrong".

title.children: Embattled steelworks behind in payments, with SA government acknowledging possibility of administration

image.altText: the outside of a building

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment's future has been saved. But, while the banking syndicate has agreed to tip in an extra $200 million in new loans to keep it afloat, complications in its rescue continued to the very end.

title.children: Star Entertainment was hanging by a thread for close on a month. Has it been saved?

image.altText: A large seal in water on its back yawning

props.synopsis: Sammy the elephant seal weighs thousands of kilograms and normally lives near Antarctica. But Portland locals have embraced him, while avoiding some of the trouble Tasmanians have experienced with another of his kind.

title.children: Victorian town falls in love with Sammy the four-tonne elephant seal

image.altText: Darcy Fort training with the Brisbane Lions in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions name Darcy Fort in place of injured ruck Oscar McInerney for Saturday's grand final, while Taylor Adams fails in his bid to make the Swans' extended squad.

title.children: Lions confirm ruck replacement for grand final as Swans make call on Adams

image.altText: Hockey gestures with one hand, sitting on the national press club stage.

props.synopsis: The former Australian treasurer and ambassador to the United States, Joe Hockey, says the US dollar will grow weaker under either of the platforms of US presidential hopefuls Donald Trump and Kamala Harris. He also warned the Republican that he had made "absurd" spending commitments.

title.children: US economy will suffer regardless of a Trump or Harris win, former treasurer Hockey warns

image.altText: Albanese and Dutton's heads in profile are aligned in the centre of the frame, Albanese scratching his neck.

props.synopsis: The whiplash-inducing negative gearing debate began with a morning story in the newspapers and ended with the Prime Minister using a report that was once used to attack Labor to defend his position.

title.children: The PM took the podium and dangled possible negative gearing changes, sparking a whiplash-inducing debate

image.altText: Graffiti Accused

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man is charged with five counts of damaging property after the incidents, which occurred between February and June.

title.children: Man arrested for allegedly spray-painting pro-Palestinian slogans on War Memorial and ABC buildings in Canberra

image.altText: A horse buggy going past a fire.

props.synopsis: As the price of copper surges globally, armed criminal syndicates are stripping South Africa bare in search of easy cash.

title.children: Armed guards spotted scattered belongings next to a manhole. Prying it open, they made a startling discovery

image.altText: A tight selfie shot of a man smiling outdoors.

props.synopsis: A father-of-two who spiked women's drinks then filmed himself raping them after they slipped into unconsciousness is found guilty in a Perth court.

title.children: Perth father who made graphic videos of himself raping women and girls he'd drugged found guilty

image.altText: Premier Chris Minns and Police Commissioner Karen Webb walking outside Bondi

props.synopsis: An exclusive ABC investigation found reports of a toxic culture has led to a mass exodus from NSW Police contributing to an almost 20 per cent shortfall in officers across the state.

title.children: 'Horrific behaviour': Premier weighs in on ABC investigation into 'toxic' NSW Police

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears high-vis and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has said any negative gearing changes must not constrain housing supply, but has pointed to research which says housing would become more affordable.

title.children: PM cools on negative gearing over supply fears, but evidence tells a different story

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The ASX snapped a three-day losing streak on Thursday, Star Casino announced a bailout, and Qantas management said they were prepared for this weekend's industrial action. Look back on our business blog to see how the day's events unfolded.

title.children: ASX closes higher, Star Casino announces bailout, Qantas engineers pursue industrial action — as it happened

image.altText: A close-up shot of a shopping trolley full of groceries in a supermarket with a woman behind bagging apples.

props.synopsis: Basic grocery items are still cheaper at Aldi when compared with Coles and Woolworths, according to consumer group Choice, which has again found little price difference between the two major grocers.

title.children: Major supermarkets are only split by $1.20 at the check-out, according to new survey

props.synopsis: The restraining order against Kate's abusive ex-partner was cancelled after paperwork was sent to her old address. She's one of three women who say they've been re-traumatised while trying to obtain court-ordered protection from their domestic violence perpetrators.

title.children: These women sought court protection from their violent partners. They didn't get it
